dialogue.htmlContent: As you've defeated all of the imps that were in the citadel, the entire place is now completely deserted.

There are at least twenty imps and alpha-imps scattered around the courtyard. A few of them are simply loitering about, but most are engaged in simple tasks such as cleaning and mending clothes, sparring with one another, or preparing and eating food. You also notice that there are a few who are openly having sex over in one corner.

None of these imps seem bothered about your sudden arrival, and you assume that it's because only expected guests would be in possession of the three keys required to gain entry.

Although the entranceway is one of the few parts of the citadel that managed to avoid taking significant damage, there's a considerable amount of rubble and smashed rock piled up against the gates. As you weave your way past these obstacles, you're very careful not to touch any of it out of fear that you might trigger another collapse.

Looking over the cracked, rubble-strewn courtyard, you find yourself gazing at the huge, ruined archway of the main keep. One of the huge wooden doors has completely splintered into pieces, while the other looks to be straining under the weight of the crumbling masonry above. Off to your left, the citadel's well looks to have been completely crushed beneath the collapsed left-side wall of the laboratory tower. On the opposite side of the courtyard, you see rubble and smashed rock blocking the small doorway of the cell block.

Standing in the entranceway, you're close enough to take a good look at the huge blocks from which the gates and walls have been constructed. You see that they've been carved from the same dark black stone as the cavern's floor and walls, and, looking out across the inner courtyard, you see that the material has indeed been obtained locally, as a large portion of the far wall has been mined out.

Carved into that gaping recess, there's a huge stone archway, which houses a pair of massive, iron-reinforced wooden doors. Off to the left of the courtyard, you see a well in one corner, and beside that, there sits a squat, stone tower. On the opposite side of the courtyard to this tower, the cave's wall curves inwards, and into this, a small doorway has been carved.

Wanting to leave this place and return another time, you walk up to the dark stone gateway. In its surface, you see three holes, which appear to be identical to the ones on the gates' exterior.

Repeating the same unlocking process that you went through when entering, the gates are soon opened, and you find yourself stepping back out into the huge, dimly-lit cavern which houses the siren's citadel. As the heavy stone gates swing shut behind you, you wonder where to go to next...

The six imps are no match for you, and you let out a triumphant laugh as the last of them falls to the floor, defeated.

Before you're able to take a breather, however, another group of imps arrive from elsewhere in the citadel, and jump forwards to avenge their fallen comrades!

Every now and then, you hear the distinctive sound of a small rock or pebble tumbling down from one of the unstable piles of rubble, reminding you to be extra careful with your movements so as not to trigger another collapse.

The citadel's large stone courtyard has been levelled and carved to resemble smooth flagstones, and it makes a nice change to be walking over such an even surface compared to the uneven floor of the cavern.

The huge, stone archway of the main keep overlooks this area, and you wonder if you should approach its massive wooden doors now, or come back another time.

The entire left-hand side of the squat tower's wall has completely collapsed, burying the citadel's well under a pile of heavy stones and smashed masonry. If you hadn't already known that there was once a well here, you'd have no idea that there was anything of note beneath this ruined wall.

In one corner of the courtyard, a small, stone well has been constructed, complete with wooden bucket and turn handle. It looks to be completely functional, and from the splashes of water on the floor at its base, you can tell that it sees regular use.

The wooden door that once was fitted to the carved-out entranceway before you now lies splintered and broken at your feet. Peering inside the cell block, you see that past the first few metres of the entranceway, the entire structure has completely caved-in. You think how it was lucky there was nobody in there at the time of collapse.

With nothing more to be done here, you turn around and prepare to head back out into the courtyard.

A sturdy wooden door has been fitted to the carved-out entranceway before you. As it's been left open, you're able to peer inside without entering, allowing you to see that, within, a block of four cells have been carved out of the cave's black rock. The front and sides of each of these cells are covered by heavy iron bars, and, within each one, a straw bed and wooden bucket have been placed against the far wall.

There are no prisoners or guards in here, and you wonder if this cell block has ever seen much use, or if it's mainly for show...

The squat tower which housed the citadel's laboratory is now in a very sorry state, with the entire of the left-hand wall having completely collapsed. Despite this, however, the entrance seems to be relatively undamaged, and you're able to venture a fair way inside before being halted by piles of rubble and debris.
You decide to spend some time searching through the ruins of the laboratory, and, being careful not to disturb any of the piles of unstable rubble, you manage to find some things of value...

A squat, one-story tower has been built over on one side of the courtyard. As you approach, you find yourself thinking that it probably once served as the original keep, before the current one was carved into the cave's wall.

The door to the tower has been left wide open, and, stepping inside, you find yourself once more in the large, round room which resembles Lilaya's laboratory. Long wooden tables have been placed around the area, and upon them, glass beakers and tubes are filled with dull-coloured, spoiled liquids. It's quite clear that this laboratory was the origin of the transformative potions being carried by Submission's imp gangs, although you wonder just how many of those potions were produced before you shut this place down.

The half-succubus which she addresses appears to be carrying a strange purple stone, and, after staring intensely at it for a moment, she looks up and replies, [style.speechFeminineStrong(Yes, Ma'am. The Captain has asked that this [pc.race] be offered our gratitude for [pc.her] help in subduing [siren.name].)]

[siren.speech(I-Impossible!)] [siren.name] weakly cries out, stumbling backwards and panting for breath. Summoning the last of her strength, she lifts her scythe up above her head, before slamming the base of the shaft down onto the stone floor. Lifting up her eyepatch, she reveals that her irises are heterochromatic, and, while her left eye is green, the one that she's just revealed is glowing purple. With a maniacal laugh, she calls out, [siren.speech(Siren's call, obliterate [pc.herHim]! I'll get my revenge...)]

With the very last of her aura's power drained by the spell she's just unleashed, the siren weakly collapses down onto the floor in front of you. Before you're able to take any further action, a loud, piercing screech suddenly echoes out around the huge throne room. You and the three demon lieutenants all cover your ears, flinching as the reverberating wail causes the ground to rumble and shake. Thankfully, this loud noise quickly fades away, but as it does, the huge stone slabs beneath your feet start to crack and break apart. From these fissures in the floor, arcane poison starts to spew forth, and, as you leap out of the way of this, the resonating vibrations from [siren.namePos] powerful spell cause a huge chunk of rock to suddenly split from the ceiling, which then falls to crash directly onto the siren's vacated throne.

[impMalesLeader.speech(We have to get out of here!)] [impMalesLeader.name] shouts, grabbing [impAlphaLeader.name] and [impFemalesLeader.name] by the arms and pushing them towards the exit. [impMalesLeader.speech(Run!)]

The siren's spell appears to have inadvertently caused the entire underground citadel to start to collapse, and, as the three demons move to make their escape, yet more chunks of the ceiling start to break apart and fall to the floor with resounding crashes.

[npc.speech(H-Help!)] [siren.name] weakly cries out, clearly too exhausted to escape this terrible danger without your assistance...

#IF pc.getHeightValue()>siren.getHeightValue() #THEN

Even though she was your enemy just a moment ago, there's no way you're going to leave [siren.name] behind! Dodging a falling chunk of the ceiling, you rush over to where she's lying on the floor, and, scooping her up in your [pc.arms], you turn and rush out of the throne room's huge stone archway, only to discover that her spell is causing the entire citadel to collapse. Huge sections of the cavern's roof are giving way and collapsing to the floor, causing the ground to shake and rumble underfoot as rocks and debris are sent scattering over the carved flagstones.

Thankfully, it looks as though the rest of the citadel's residents immediately started evacuating at the first sign of danger, and, over on the far side of the courtyard, the last group of imps are rushing out of the main gateway. With your heart pounding in your chest, and the small siren cowering in your [pc.arms], you somehow manage to dodge all of the falling boulders and collapsing masonry as you rush across the courtyard and follow the three demons out into Submission's cavern.

Miraculously, you see that everyone within the citadel managed to make it out without serious injury, but, while that's a relief for everybody involved, your troubles aren't over yet. Surrounding the main gates, and with arcane muskets at the ready, there are at least thirty of Lyssieth's elite guard, who are busy taking all of the escaping imps into custody. Several of them are also talking to [siren.namePos] lieutenants, but, due to their demon status, it looks like they're going to be released without anything happening to them.

There's no hope of any escape from this situation, and as you wonder what to do next, the half-succubus officer in charge points at you and orders, [genericFemale.speech(Stop! You there, [pc.race], release [siren.name], right this instant!)]

Realising what you've just done, and that she's about to be taken away, [siren.name] blushes as she looks up into your eyes. [siren.speech(Y-You saved me... If it wasn't for you, w-well... Thank you!)]

Realising that you have no choice but to do as the officer says, you carefully let [siren.name] down to stand on her own two feet. Immediately, four of Lyssieth's guards step forwards, and, looping their arms under [siren.namePos], they march off in the direction of her mother's palace.

[genericFemale.speech(Now, you can explain to us exactly what's going on!)] the officer says, impatiently tapping her foot as she waits for your response.

There's no way that you're going to risk your life to save [siren.name]! Seeing that you've exited the throne room without [siren.name], [impMaleLeader.name] runs back towards you, before rushing past and heroically charging into the collapsing keep.

Miraculously, the three of you manage to make it out without injury, and, just a few seconds afterwards, [impMaleLeader.name] staggers out with [siren.name] in his arms. [siren.speech(I can't believe you were going to leave me to die in there!)] [siren.name] shouts at you as four of the guards start dragging her away in the direction of her mother's palace. [siren.speech(I hate you!)]
[genericFemale.speech(Now, you can explain to us exactly what's going on!)] the half-succubus officer in charge says, impatiently tapping her foot as she waits for your response.

You're unable to continue fighting the three demons, and, staggering back, you collapse to the floor, defeated.

[siren.speech(~Mwhaha!~)] [siren.name] laughs. [siren.speech(You weren't even a match for my lieutenants! Count yourself lucky that I wasn't forced to unleash my vast arcane power upon you! Now... I think you need to be punished!)]

You're unable to continue fighting, and, staggering back, you collapse to the floor, defeated.

[siren.speech(~Mwhaha!~)] [siren.name] laughs. [siren.speech(You were no match for my colossal power, just as I expected! Count yourself lucky that I chose to hold back; if I'd have unleashed my full power, who knows what'd have happened to you! Now... I think you need to be punished!)]

You look up to see a delighted grin on the siren's face, and as you let out a heavy sigh, she commands her lieutenants, [siren.speech(You three! Restrain [pc.herHim]! I want to watch you fuck [pc.herHim]!)]

You look up to see a delighted grin on the siren's face, and as you let out a heavy sigh, she commands her lieutenants, [siren.speech(You three! Throw [pc.herHim] out of my citadel!)]

As the demons grab you under your [pc.arms] and lift you up, [siren.name] shouts, [siren.speech(If you dare to return, I'll be more than happy to destroy you all over again!)]
You don't mind the sound of that, and, as [siren.name] sits back on her throne to watch, you allow the three demons to move you into position, ready to fuck you...
You like the sound of that, and, as [siren.name] sits back on her throne to watch, you eagerly allow the three demons to move you into position, ready to fuck you...
You don't like the sound of that, and, as [siren.name] sits back on her throne to watch, you desperately struggle against the thee demons as they force you into position, ready to fuck you...

The three demons step back, grinning down at you as you collapse to the floor of the siren's throne room. As you let out an exhausted sigh, [siren.name] shouts out, [siren.speech(That was fun to watch! Now, throw [pc.herHim] out of my citadel!)]

As the demons grab you under your [pc.arms] and lift you up, [siren.name] shouts, [siren.speech(If you dare to return, I'll be more than happy to destroy you all over again!)]

The three demons drag you out of the throne room's archway and out into the courtyard. As they take you over to the entranceway, all of the imps throughout the citadel start pointing and laughing at you. With your cheeks burning from shame, the demons unceremoniously hurl you out of the front gates, and [impMaleLeader.name] shouts after you, [impMaleLeader.speech(And stay out!)]

Letting out a deep sigh, you push yourself up onto your [pc.feet], and after brushing yourself off, you wonder what to do next...
